Description: Mummy of a girl. The body is decorated with gilded rectangles. Skull - The head is flexed. Thorax and Abdomen - These cavities appear to be empty. All bones normal and free from fractures, dislocation, and disease. The intervertebral disc spaces are normal. Arms - Extended. Hands with extended fingers, their palmar surfaces in contact with the outer aspect of the thighs. Legs - All Bones normal. Menisci opaque.
Curator's comments: Discussed: Leslie and Levell, International Journal of Dermatology 45 (2006), 620. Davey et al, Yearbook of Mummy Studies 2 (2014), 81-6.
Bibliographic references: Dawson & Gray 1968 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antqiuities in the British Museum: Mummies and Human Remains (72)
Fletcher, Antoine and Hill 2014 / Regarding the Dead: Human Remains in the British Museum (p.106, p.111, table 1)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
